result.execSummary:
The defendant Emmanuel Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • County Retail Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Collected by the Clerk of courts.

records.addlTxt:
9:39 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Emmanuel Erickson in court.  Attorney Ryan Glenn Kohler in court for Emmanuel Erickson. 
There is an offer from the State requiring prepayment of restitution. Defendant has paid the restitution. 
State moves to amend to a county ordinance for retail theft- Court accepts State's motion. Defendant pleads guilty to the amended count. 
Court accepts plea, finds the defendant Guilty and orders court costs. Anything else is dismissed and read in.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
